headline: Samsung Electronics says customers praised competitiveness of HBM4 chip
summary: Samsung Electronics customers have praised the differentiated competitiveness of ​its next-generation high-bandwidth memory (HBM) chips, or ‌HBM4, saying "Samsung is back", co-CEO and chip chief ‌Jun Young-hyun said in a New Year address.  In October, Samsung said it was in "close discussion" to supply its HBM4 to U.S. artificial ⁠intelligence leader Nvidia, ‌as the South Korean chipmaker scrambles to catch rivals including compatriot ‍SK Hynix in AI chips.  SK Hynix commanded 53% of the HBM market in the third quarter ​of 2025, followed by Samsung at ‌35% and Micron at 11%, showed data from Counterpoint Research.

content.title: Samsung Electronics says customers praised competitiveness of HBM4 chip
content.summary: Samsung Electronics customers have praised the differentiated competitiveness of ​its next-generation high-bandwidth memory (HBM) chips, or ‌HBM4, saying "Samsung is back", co-CEO and chip chief ‌Jun Young-hyun said in a New Year address.  In October, Samsung said it was in "close discussion" to supply its HBM4 to U.S. artificial ⁠intelligence leader Nvidia, ‌as the South Korean chipmaker scrambles to catch rivals including compatriot ‍SK Hynix in AI chips.  SK Hynix commanded 53% of the HBM market in the third quarter ​of 2025, followed by Samsung at ‌35% and Micron at 11%, showed data from Counterpoint Research.

headline: AI Chips Update - EdgeMode Expands AI Infrastructure With Strategic Spanish Developments
summary: Recent developments in the AI chip sector have been highlighted by EdgeMode Inc.'s year-end shareholder letter, detailing significant advancements in their AI data center portfolio in Spain. The company has secured a 1.5GW capacity through definitive agreements, aiming to position itself as a major AI infrastructure developer in Europe. Key initiatives include transitioning the Spanish sites towards construction readiness and integrating Battery Energy Storage Systems (BESS) to enhance...

headline: Apple Stock’s Growth Trajectory Is Challenged in 2026. Why This Analyst Is Staying on the Sidelines.
summary: While  Apple  stock could eke out some gains in the new year, don’t expect it to generate eye-watering returns.  Before suspending coverage, the analysts rated  Apple  at Outperform, meaning the latest recommendation technically is a step down.  While Apple ended the year in the green, it wasn’t a notably strong performer.

headline: CES 2026: The costs of memory chips amid tech's data center pivot
summary: The costs of memory chips — especially those used in consumer devices — are expected to see a sharp rise in 2026 as more mega-cap tech companies ramp up their CapEx spending into AI infrastructure and data center projects. Yahoo Finance tech editor Dan Howley discusses the pricing pressures and demand surrounding these memory chip manufacturers and DRAM (Dynamic Random Access Memory). Also catch Dan Howley lay out what to expect in Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's keynote address at the 2026 Consumer Technology Association (CES) event on Monday, January 5. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

content.title: CES 2026: The costs of memory chips amid tech's data center pivot
content.description:
The costs of memory chips — especially those used in consumer devices — are expected to see a sharp rise in 2026 as more mega-cap tech companies ramp up their CapEx spending into AI infrastructure and data center projects.

Yahoo Finance tech editor Dan Howley discusses the pricing pressures and demand surrounding these memory chip manufacturers and DRAM (Dynamic Random Access Memory).

Also catch Dan Howley lay out what to expect in Nvidia CEO Jensen Huang's keynote address at the 2026 Consumer Technology Association (CES) event on Monday, January 5.

To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.

headline: AI Stocks Are Doing the Heavy Lifting Today
summary: The Nasdaq Composite was up 0.2%.  The top stocks in the S&P were Sandisk and Micron Technology, along with other firms tied to the AI trade.  For a large chunk of 2024 and 2025, stocks linked to the AI buildout lifted the S&P 500 and Nasdaq, even on days when most stocks were trading sideways.

headline: AI trade in 2026: Should investors be looking outside the Mag 7?
summary: The Magnificent Seven companies were the talk of Wall Street in 2025 as investors speculated how much further these tech stocks could run in the AI trade. Are there any companies outside the Mag 7 that investors should consider in 2026? Roundhill Investments Chief Executive Officer Dave Mazza shares his outlook for the AI trade in 2026 on the first trading day of the new year. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Morning Brief.
